intro: Cicerbita azurea, commonly known as the blue-flowered cicerbit, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
